etymology.description: semantic: 氵(氵) (shuǐ, "water") + phonetic: 朝(朝) (zhāo, "morning") = water movements -> tide
etymology.interpretation: The character 潮 (cháo, "tide") combines the water radical 氵(氵) (shuǐ, "water") with the phonetic component 朝(朝) (zhāo, "morning"), indicating movements or changes associated with water, such as tides.

examples.chinese: 海潮退去时(海潮退去時)，沙滩变得湿润(沙灘變得濕潤)。
examples.pinyin: Hǎi cháo tuìqù shí, shātān biàn dé shīrùn.
examples.english: When the tide recedes, the beach becomes moist.

examples.chinese: 他家衣服总是半潮半湿(他家衣服總是半潮半濕)。
examples.pinyin: Tā jiā yīfú zǒng shì bàn cháo bàn shī.
examples.english: The clothes at his home are always somewhat damp.

examples.chinese: 晚风吹来(晚風吹來)，海边的潮声渐起(海邊的潮聲漸起)。
examples.pinyin: Wǎn fēng chuī lái, hǎibiān de cháo shēng jiàn qǐ.
examples.english: The evening breeze blows, and the sound of the tide by the sea gradually rises.
